The Incredible Donors

The generosity of birth tissue donors like you enables breakthrough medical research to restore vision and heal surgical wounds for countless other people. The selfless donation of your placenta after your baby’s healthy birth can mean a life-changing outcome for another human life.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|desktop” admin_label=”Section” _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”50px||20px|” custom_padding_tablet=”50px|0|50px|0″ custom_padding_phone=”” transparent_background=”off” padding_mobile=”off” make_fullwidth=”off” use_custom_width=”off” width_unit=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row padding_mobile=”off” column_padding_mobile=”on” admin_label=”Row” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_padding=”0px|0px” make_fullwidth=”off” use_custom_width=”off” width_unit=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Title: Overview” _builder_version=”4.16″ text_text_color=”#b37ab4″ text_font_size=”35″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Our Birth Tissue Donation Program

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|desktop” admin_label=”section” _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”0px||50px|” custom_padding_tablet=”50px|0|50px|0″ custom_padding_phone=”” transparent_background=”off” padding_mobile=”off” make_fullwidth=”off” use_custom_width=”off” width_unit=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row padding_mobile=”off” column_padding_mobile=”on” admin_label=”row” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_padding=”0px|0px” make_fullwidth=”off” use_custom_width=”off” width_unit=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Donors Overview” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ text_font=”|on|||” text_text_color=”#b37ab4″ text_line_height=”1.8em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_margin=”||50px|” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

The placenta and portion of the umbilical cord, or afterbirth, is normally discarded after delivery. If you give permission for placenta to be donated and you qualify for participation, the placenta will be collected by BTR rather than discarded. The collection of the placenta and its attached umbilical cord will take place after delivery of your baby. The collection will not affect the delivery or the care of you or your baby.

We invite you to read all about BTR, our company history and the wonderful people who work with our donors.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row padding_mobile=”off” column_padding_mobile=”on” admin_label=”Row” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_padding=”0px|50px” make_fullwidth=”off” use_custom_width=”off” width_unit=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_toggle title=”Purpose of Placenta Donation” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Purpose of Placenta Donation” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_text_color=”#92278f” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

The main purpose of birth tissue donation is to provide tissue-based products for wound coverings, diabetic ulcers, sports medicine, ophthalmology, spine, or dental procedures. Donated tissue is also utilized in the development of new clinical products or general research studies. Your participation is entirely voluntary.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Process for Donating Your Birth Tissue” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Process” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_text_color=”#92278f” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

A mother qualifies to donate if she does not have any diseases that could be passed on to a patient who receives transplant products made from the birth tissues.

To donate, you will be asked to:

  • Read, understand, and sign a consent form.
  • Complete a medical and social history questionnaire.
  • Allow blood to be drawn and tested.
  • Permit BTR to review, make copies, and retain portions of your medical record.

The consent, history questionnaire, medical records, and blood specimens are used to ensure the safety of tissue for use. You will complete a questionnaire similar to one used for blood donation. The questionnaire will be completed during a brief, private interview.

In most cases, blood is drawn at the same time as the hospital draw so a second stick can be avoided. Your blood will be tested for several infections that could transmit disease through use of products made from birth tissue. Infectious disease testing is mandated by law whenever human tissue is used for transplantation. If necessary, we will report the results of these tests to your physician within 3-4 weeks. Your physician will discuss with you the meaning of these results.

The review of your medical record is strictly confidential. Information and documents are accessed only by trained, authorized personnel working in a secure environment.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Risks in Donating Your Birth Tissues” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Risks” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_text_color=”#92278f” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

There are no significant risks related to donating your birth tissues.

  • The amount of blood drawn from you is small and not enough to affect your health.
  • Taking blood from you has a small risk of slight pain and bruising, lightheadedness, possible fainting and, rarely, infection.
  • Some of the questions that we will ask you are of a personal nature and may cause you to feel embarrassed.
  • The placenta is not needed after delivery.
  • If your doctor decides that the placenta should be evaluated after your baby is born, then it will be used for that purpose.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Potential Benefits of Birth Tissue Donation” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Potential Benefits” _builder_version=”4.16″ title_text_color=”#92278f” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]You will be helping other people with products that heal wounds, or develop helpful new treatments.

Human amniotic membrane is a versatile, effective wound treatment, and in some cases has effectively treated wounds otherwise unresponsive to usual therapeutic measures.
[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Confidentiality in Your Birth Tissue Donation” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Confidentiality” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_text_color=”#92278f” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Birth Tissue Recovery staff will attach a unique identification code to the donated tissue and the records related to your donation.

To protect your privacy, we keep all information that contains your personal identifiers confidential and in a secure location, with access allowed only to authorized personnel.

We will not identify you or your baby in any publications. Our processes are HIPAA compliant.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Costs of Donating Your Placenta (Birth Tissue)” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Costs” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_text_color=”#92278f” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Birth tissues are normally thrown away after delivery.

There will be no cost to you.

We are prohibited by law from providing or offering monetary compensation or other valuable consideration to donors.

Participation is your choice.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Financial Disclosure” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Financial Disclosure” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_text_color=”#92278f” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Birth Tissue Recovery LLC is a for-profit entity and is paid for its services. Hospitals are paid for drawing blood, computer use, and printing. There is no cost to you.

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|desktop” admin_label=”Section” module_id=”donor_faq” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_color=”#fbf4ff” custom_padding=”0px|||” custom_padding_tablet=”50px|0|50px|0″ custom_padding_phone=”” transparent_background=”off” padding_mobile=”off” make_fullwidth=”off” use_custom_width=”off” width_unit=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row padding_mobile=”off” column_padding_mobile=”on” admin_label=”Row” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_padding=”80px|0px” make_fullwidth=”off” use_custom_width=”off” width_unit=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Title: FAQs” _builder_version=”4.16″ text_font=”|on|||” text_text_color=”#ffffff” text_font_size=”20″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

FAQs About Placenta Donation

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row padding_mobile=”off” column_padding_mobile=”on” admin_label=”Row” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_padding=”50px|50px” make_fullwidth=”off” use_custom_width=”off” width_unit=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_toggle title=”Do I qualify to donate my birth tissue?” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Do I qualify?” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_line_height=”1.3em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

If you have questions please contact BTR and ask to speak to your hospital’s BTR donation coordinator.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”What Type Of Placenta Tissue Can Be Donated?” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Do I qualify?” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_line_height=”1.3em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” hover_enabled=”0″ border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_enabled=”0″]

Birth tissue includes the placenta and umbilical cord.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”What is Donated Birth Tissue and Placenta Used For?” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Do I qualify?” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_line_height=”1.3em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” hover_enabled=”0″ border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}” sticky_enabled=”0″]

Donated birth tissue and placenta is provided to companies that use the tissue to create wound care products to treat burns, ocular surface diseases, diabetic ulcers, repair soft tissue, reduce post-operative scarring, and other types of wound repairs.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Can I also donate cord blood?” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Can I also donate cord blood?” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_line_height=”1.3em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Birth tissue donation will not interfere with your decision, if you have done so, to donate cord blood. You will be able to donate both your placenta and cord blood if you choose to do so.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Why do you need to review/make copies of my medical record?” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Why do you need to review/make copies of my medical record?” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_line_height=”1.3em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • You will be asked to permit BTR staff to review and, when necessary, make copies of your medical record, and obtain a blood specimen to help ensure the safety of tissue for use. A mother qualifies to donate if she does not have any disease that could be passed on to a patient who receives transplant products made from her birth tissues. The review of your medical record is strictly confidential and all information and documents remain private.
  • The medical record review, done by trained and experienced BTR staff, helps make sure the tissue is safe for use. All information is kept strictly confidential and no identifying information is shared with anyone. You will complete a questionnaire similar to one used for blood donations. The medical review and questionnaire will be completed during a brief, private interview.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Are there any potential risks or discomforts with birth tissue donation?” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Are there any potential risks or discomforts?” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_line_height=”1.3em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • There are no significant risks related to donating your birth tissues. The amount of blood drawn from you is small and not enough to affect your health. Taking blood from you has a small risk of slight pain and bruising, light-headedness, possible fainting and, rarely, infection. Most often, we will obtain your blood sample at the same time as other specimens that your doctor requests during your routine medical care. This way no extra needle stick is necessary.
  • You may ask to review the questions before deciding whether to participate.
  • If you give permission for placenta donation and your physician decides it is best that the placenta be evaluated after your baby is born, then it will be used instead for that purpose.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”How does it help other people?” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”How does it help other people?” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_line_height=”1.3em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Hospitals treat placentas as medical waste or biohazard material. The newborn placenta is placed in a biohazard bag for storage. Some hospitals keep the placenta for a period of time in case the need arises to send it to pathology for further analysis.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Are there any costs related to donating my placenta?” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”Are there any costs related to donating my placenta?” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_line_height=”1.3em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Birth tissues are normally discarded after delivery. There will be no cost to you for any aspect of the donation. We will not pay you for the birth tissue donation. Participation is voluntary. Choosing not to participate will not affect your medical care in any way.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”What if I have more questions about donating my placenta?” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#fbf4ff” admin_label=”What if I have more questions?” _builder_version=”4.25.0″ title_line_height=”1.3em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” border_width_all=”1px” border_color_all=”#dbdbdb” border_style_all=”solid” use_border_color=”on” border_color=”#dbdbdb” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

You may ask questions any time during the consent process. Afterward, you may call Birth Tissue Recovery at (336) 448-1910 or send an email to info@birthtissuerecovery.com.

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|desktop” admin_label=”Section” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_color=”#ffffff”
